turns.speaker: DELBANCO
turns.text: Well... you see, when I broke it off with Phyllis, she was naturally upset and she became more determined than ever to pursue certain -- how to put it -- doubts she's been harboring...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What kind of doubts?

turns.speaker: DELBANCO
turns.text: About you... your background and your qualifications. I'm afraid Phyllis somehow got you mixed up in her fury with me, and actually took the whole issue to the state board.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: DELBANCO
turns.text: And please, for whatever small way I may have encouraged this, accept my apologies.  There is good news, though.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: DELBANCO
turns.text: Phyllis has decided to leave town and pursue her practice in the city. Which leaves you the only psychologist in town.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Dr. Sheeler is leaving Mumford? I'm sorry to hear that.

turns.speaker: DELBANCO
turns.text: As you can imagine, my own feelings about this are mixed... Unlike, I must say, those of my wife.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: I have eighteen more minutes!

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I don't want to hear any more today.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Mr. Follett, do you trust me or don't you?

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: Well, I don't know... I only been seeing you --

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Without trust, there's no point to any of this. You might as well not come.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: Now hold on, I didn't say I didn't want to come --

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Good, then go.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: Or maybe it wasn't an accident at all --

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Mr. Follett.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: -- 'cause in that instant I saw the beginning of a vixen's smile and I knew --

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Henry!

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Stop now.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: Why? I'm paying for this.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Not for this. Not me, you're not.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: You find it distasteful, don't you?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: It doesn't matter how I feel about it. It's how you feel about it that matters.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: I enjoy it. Does that make me some kind of pervert? Just because a man has a rich imaginative life --

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You didn't come to me because you have a rich imagination.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You came because it's taking over. You're in its grip.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: I never said that.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Where's your wife, Henry?

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: Go to hell.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I didn't hear you.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: We got divorced.  I had to get rid of her. She couldn't satisfy me.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: I was... never satisfied.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Now we're back on track.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: You are so mean.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: It's a thought I had.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: Should I open it now?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Let me just say something here... I have no idea if this is going to help.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: What exactly is it supposed to do?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You remember when I asked you about pornography --

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: -- I find it degrading. Maximum gynecology and minimum turn-on --

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: -- and you told me that. Still, there's some kind of imagery that's haunting you and, I think, getting in your way --

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: -- Which I don't necessarily agree.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: But you did come to me.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: My guess is these images were burned into your brain when you were young. Maybe if we could nail down the exact fantasies that are haunting you -- maybe you could get past them... Anyway, I thought we could try an experiment.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: And the experiment is in here?

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: Whoa, whoa, what are you doing? I want to know what's in here.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: There's absolutely no reason to think this is going to have any impact on you. I'm embarrassed to have --

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: Uh, sorry, I'm going to have to...  ...I really appreciate what you're trying to... uh, I can't thank you enough for...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: My pleasure.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I feel like we're making real progress here.

turns.speaker: FOLLETT
turns.text: Me too, Doc. And I can't tell you what that package meant to me --

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I didn't see you there. Can I help you?

turns.speaker: GILROY
turns.text: My name's Gilroy. I'm from the State Certification Board.

turns.speaker: GILROY
turns.text: It's all right, it won't bite you. Under civil code 1294.67b you are entitled to be notified that your status and certification are being reviewed. This is the notice.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Do you want to come in?

turns.speaker: GILROY
turns.text: No thanks. Plenty of time for that when we're a little further along.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Mr. Gilroy --

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What brought this on?

turns.speaker: GILROY
turns.text: I'm not at liberty to say. Sometimes it's just routine, sometimes there's been a complaint. We'll be in touch.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: You must be Dr. Mumford of Mumford. Jeremy Brockett.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Doc. Nice to meet you.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: Sorry I'm late... traffic was a motherfucker. Have another drink, I'll be back in five.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: I think you'll like this. Know much about Cuban cigars?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: Are you a man who likes to treat himself right?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I've had my moments.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: I am. And I'm not ashamed of it. Nobody ever said on their death bed -- "I treated myself too well."

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I thought it was -- Nobody ever said, "I should have spent more time at the office."

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: Fill in the blank. I don't mind the office. The point is, you only go 'round once. Like the Zens say -- Be here now.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What do you do?

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: Althea hasn't told you?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: We've been talking about her, mostly.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: Well, in '85 four of us left our firms and formed an investment banking venture. We've got twenty-three people working there now.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You've done well.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: We've done... very well. You know anything about addiction, Doc?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: A little.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: Well, I'm addicted to winning. I say when you're in the red zone, you gotta score.  So what do you think?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Tastes good.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: No... I mean about Althea. About her...  ...behavior. Do you think you can fix her up?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What do you think's wrong with her?

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: She's gone weird is what's wrong with her. Out of control. Probably from living out here in Mayberry.

turns.speaker: JEREMY
turns.text: You're the doctor, what do you think?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: She seems very unhappy.

turns.speaker: JUDGE OTTO
turns.text: Clarence Norman White, do you understand how serious are the crimes with which you have been charged?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: JUDGE OTTO
turns.text: Do you realize how insidious it is to invade the most private thoughts and secret lives of unsuspecting people?...

turns.speaker: JUDGE OTTO
turns.text: ...People who have come to you with the faith that you know what you're doing... and that you are who you say you are?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Yes, your honor.

turns.speaker: JUDGE OTTO
turns.text: It means absolutely nothing to me that so many of your patients have come forward with praise for you and your therapeutic skills. You understand that?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JUDGE OTTO
turns.text: Mr. White, I am frustrated that the criminal code in this state allows a maximum sentence of only six months and a maximum fine of only $2000.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I'm sorry, your honor.

turns.speaker: JUDGE OTTO
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I'm sorry you're frustrated.

turns.speaker: JUDGE OTTO
turns.text: Are you disrespecting this court, Mr. White?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: No, sir. I was empathizing. Sorry.

turns.speaker: JUDGE OTTO
turns.text: Maybe you can empathize with this -- Maximum fine. Three months in jail, three months house arrest. Sentence to begin immediately at the Orchard Valley Correctional Facility. Case closed. This court is adjourned.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Yeah... me you, too... I was at your house...

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Oh?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Upstairs, with Doc... Yeah, it's very nice... I heard your shower.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: I've seen you going by on your board, but I didn't realize -- you're so young... to be so...

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: So, is this like a Japanese restaurant?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: I'd better get in there.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: That's a lot of people all at once.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: It's okay. They pre-order. There's a choice of three entrees.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: What are they?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Meat loaf, turkey quesadillas, or salad nicoise.

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Salad nicoise? I love salad nicoise.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: SKIP
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Well, come on in.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You're early... it's not ready. What happened?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: My patient had to leave early.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Who was that?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Does the phrase "nosy" have any meaning to you, Lily?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: I think it's like... inquisitive.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: It was Henry Follett.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Man, you see him a lot. And it's very wrong to reveal it. Next you'll be saying what his problem is.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What do you want to know?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You're terrible. I'm never telling you anything.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: How long you been in this town?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Oh, I don't know...

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Four months, two and a half weeks -- that's how long.  And you've already got more patients than those other two shrinks combined.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Lily, I don't think even you could know that --

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You know who that is, don't you?  You really don't? That's Skip Skipperton, man. He gets himself hit by a truck, this whole town shuts down.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Oh, so that's him? The Panda Man.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: So, what makes you so popular? What's your secret?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You like me. How come?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Not sure. Let me think about it.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: How ya doin', Ainge? Evenin', Lily.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Doc.  Ainge...

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Do we run into the street? No, I didn't think so.  Nice car. How's that place?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: It's a pretty piece of land.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: And the Brocketts?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Horror show. What'd you do tonight?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: It was insane here, man. 'Hadda call in the National Guard.  Then I did my laundry... watched 20/20.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: ...And?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Shocking. Did you know the government is wasteful?  You heard it here first. Oh, and being a supermodel... it's no walk in the park.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Why do you watch?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: No gentleman caller, Doc.  Not that I care. I've had it with men. They're so fascinated by their own crap. Took me four years to get the last one out. Almost turned me into a dyke... These days my idea of a hot date is a long shower by myself before bed. Now that feels good. And you don't have to do all that... listening.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: They come through a few times each year.  Hello, Mrs. Saito, good to see you again!  It's a tour.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Where am I supposed to eat?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: You're on your own today, honey.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Lily, I want you to meet Skip. Skip, Lily.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: It's a pleasure to meet you.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: ...so rich?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: ...so accomplished.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Doc...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Lily.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Doc.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: I don't want you to be mad at Skip...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: He told you.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Skip and I wouldn't have got together if it weren't for you. That's a big deal.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You would have met in some shower eventually...

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: I want to give you something. Will you let me?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Thanks, Lily, I don't need anything.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Yes, you do, you damn well do.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Here it is, some advice -- do the hard thing.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: That's it? That's what you're giving me?

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Clean up the mess. No matter what it takes.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What it might take is... doing time.

turns.speaker: LILY
turns.text: Too bad. That's tough, I mean it. I'm not unsympathetic. But Skip says you're in love.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: -- you can sit up and look at me if you'd like --  -- maybe it would be helpful if you told me a little about what brought you here.

turns.speaker: LIONEL
turns.text: Kind of impatient for a big-time headshrinker, aren't you? How 'bout you let me explain it my own way...

turns.speaker: LIONEL
turns.text: ...but it's not really my school -- and this is very interesting -- it's the school from the next district --

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: -- Go on!

turns.speaker: LIONEL
turns.text: -- you crazy? You can't do this!

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Sure I can, Lionel.

turns.speaker: LIONEL
turns.text: I'm a criminal lawyer -- you think I like my clients? I can't stand most of them! But I don't kick them out...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: See that sign -- We retain the right to refuse service to anyone. I'm not going to charge you for this session, but I don't want to see you back here.

turns.speaker: LIONEL
turns.text: Don't you at least have a back door I can use?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Come out this way. There's no shame in getting a little therapy... is there, Althea?

turns.speaker: LIONEL
turns.text: Maybe some of us don't need this crap!

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: And it's the Hubble Telescope, not the Himball Telescope.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Hello, Lionel.

turns.speaker: LIONEL
turns.text: You've got to have the right ladder for the job. You don't know what you're doing, you can get yourself in trouble.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You're right, as usual. See you.

turns.speaker: LIONEL
turns.text: It's a country club. Don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Thanks for your help, Lionel.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: But you know how to drive?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Got a license?  But no car?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Don't need it.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I just got my license two weeks ago.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You're good.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I been drivin' since I was twelve.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: That would explain it.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Can you help Mom?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I'm trying.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Got to.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: What's wrong with her?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Is she a friend of yours?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: No... sort of. Man, she could be cool, but all she does is get wrecked and do all the guys. She's blowin' them in the parking lot.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Hiya, Doc.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Martin.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Did you straighten her out?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Insane! Didn't ja hear? My family got five hundred times better.  Let's go, Vanessa.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Hello, Mother. I want you to meet Dr. Mumford.

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: Mumford... like the town?

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: What's happening here?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: We're going for a walk.

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: Do you think that's a good idea?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Dr. Mumford does, yes. I've put myself completely in his hands. For today, anyway.

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: What kind of doctor are you?

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: It'll never happen! You're in big trouble, mister.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Mother... go away!

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Ph.D., psychologist.

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: Oh... not a real doctor.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: That's right, the fake kind.

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: What'd you want?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: There's something I think we need to talk about.

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: Finally, some common sense...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: I think you know what I mean.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: No, I really don't.

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: I think you do.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Why don't you tell me?

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: Why don't you go to hell? It's all a bunch of nonsense and you know it.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Well... you see, the problem is --

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: -- the problem is you're a big fake. You haven't got a clue what's wrong with that girl.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Wow. You're something.

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: Take a hike, Dr. Quack!

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: Well, look who's here...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Good evening, Mrs. Cook.

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: Just who is here, can you tell me?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Could I see Sofie, please?

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: No, you can not. I wouldn't know who to say is calling.

turns.speaker: MRS. COOK
turns.text: Sofie. It's so obvious... you're after my daughter.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Well, I gotta say, Mrs. Cook, you're right about that.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Feel free to lie down. Most people do.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I'd better not, I'll fall right to sleep. I think it's too soon for me to be sleeping with you.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What can you tell me about this?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Oh, lord. It's almost too exhausting to tell you...  ...about my exhaustion. I didn't really want to come. I'm not hopeful right now. But I couldn't take the look on my dad's face. He's a truly kind person, which is pretty extraordinary if you knew the story. He's the opposite of me, I guess -- all stamina and resolve.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: When did you start to feel this way?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: About six months ago, I guess it is now. God, it seems like years. What a bore! I'm embarrassed by it. Before this happened -- when I'd hear people talk about this kind of thing -- I thought it was a bunch of bullshit.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: You think that now! You think it's a bunch of hooey, don't you?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I saw it. I saw it in your eyes.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: That's okay. Maybe it is. My mother always says -- "Everything that's wrong with you is in your head." I suppose that's true.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Back when this started, was there anything unusual happening in your life? A change of job, of living situation... a loss of some kind?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: No... but it started one year to the day after my divorce became final. That's not too suspicious, is it?... But it wasn't like I was feeling bad about the divorce. Just the opposite.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Hmm.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Hmm? Is that a professional opinion?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Hmm, as in -- that's interesting. Sometimes, with enough clues, it's possible to figure these things out.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Even if you don't think it's real?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I don't know what's real and what isn't. That's never been my strong suit. But if you're tired all the time and you've had to give up the life you were having and come back home when you didn't want to... that's worth trying to fix. Maybe I can help you do that.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: What would you do?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: We... we would try several things. But I need to see you a lot.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I don't know. I barely made it today.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I'll come to you. We'll try a little walking.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: We'll take it slow. You'll never feel you can't handle it.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I don't think I can afford it. I don't want my dad paying.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: We'll work it out.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: You have the best answer for everything.  You seem so... hopeful. Are you always this sunny?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: No one ever thought so. You must bring it out.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Is it contagious? 'Cause everyone agrees my immune system's way down.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Maybe you'll catch it.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Can I ask you something?  Didn't you tell my dad you didn't think it was a good idea to come to the patient?  So what changed?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I'm not making any promises.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: We'll turn back anytime you want.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Oh boy... this should be interesting.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Mom's such a cutie.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: People usually have to get to know me before they hate me.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: She's not in a bad mood. She's like that all the time.  It doesn't bother me anymore. It's my dad and my brother I worry about.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Maybe... but you're the one whose ass is dragging.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Is that the technical description of what I've got?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Is she against you getting help?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: We don't discuss it.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Something's bothering her.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Oh, we've all disappointed her. Me, especially, but Dad, of course. She thinks my brother's all right, but she didn't expect much. It's what happens when you "marry beneath yourself"...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Please... forgive me.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Negative thinking makes everything more difficult. If you're going to have enough strength to do this, we have to talk only about positive things. All right?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Okay then... Are you positive your mother's a bitch?  Just kidding.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: You've got a funny idea of funny.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I've offended you!

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Really? What would it take?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Is this the treatment?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Sorry... I'm done.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: 'Cause I'll tell you, none of the others have tried this approach.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I'm embarrassed. The list is so long.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Be specific.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Well... I'm tired all the time, obviously. I always feel like taking a nap. But when I try to sleep, I have trouble.  My muscles ache. And my joints. I feel like an old person, or like I did back when I used to work out too hard... What else?...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Sore throat?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Painful lymph glands?  Forget fulness... irritability... depression?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Yes, yes, and definitely yes. Also... I get confused.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Yeah, most people have that. It's confusing here.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Life.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I don't know if I mentioned the headaches.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Did you get headaches before this?  But you get more now? Or more severe?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: No, not really. They're about the same. My marriage was one long headache.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: So the headaches may not even be a part of this?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I can give myself a headache instantly.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Is that like a party trick?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: All I have to do is have two conflicting thoughts at the same time... Like I'll think -- 'Taking these walks is going to help Sofie get better.' But then I'll also think -- 'Mumford, you just enjoy taking these walks and you're kidding yourself about the benefits.'

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: There... I've given myself a real whopper.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: You actually address yourself by name in your thoughts?  So you really think having two opposing ideas in your head does some kind of damage?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Sometimes, yeah... pulling in two different directions at once. It makes tiny little tears in our fabric.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Well then, my life has been some kind of huge rip.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You're doing great.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I don't know if I'm going to make it the whole way.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: It doesn't matter. Go on.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Oh... this makes me sound irrational, which is probably right, but there was something about him saying this -- it was maybe the millionth time he'd told me about some preference of his. Well, I was so... tired of it.  Seems like my whole life someone's been telling me... I'm just not getting it right. Can we rest for a second?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: You're purposely making me talk while we do this...  ...because you think this is good for me...  ...and you're a sadistic bastard...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: ...who thinks there's nothing really wrong with me.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Oh, there's something wrong with you, all right. Especially after hearing that dream of yours, about the Roto-Rooter.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: That was really bad, wasn't it?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Disgusting.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: And I'll bet you can interpret the whole thing

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: It's pretty obvious to a trained professional.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Is that when you split up?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: No, that'd be a good story, but that was just the beginning of the end. We went on for another year or so.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: So whose route is this?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Brady Peck's. Fourteen years old. Lives next door.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: And he's where?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: In the capitol for Boy's Nation. Five days. Why?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I'm thinking a gal could make a good living doing this. How hard could it be squeezing out some fourteen year old?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You like it?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: It's all right.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Then you can expect me at 5:30 tomorrow morning.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: And this is legitimate therapy?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Therapy? Hell no, I just don't want to do it alone.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: When I was in high school we used to come up here and make out. I liked to sit on the rock and watch the sun go down.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: That's what I like.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Which thing?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Either one.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Why'd you come to the house the other night?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I thought I had something to tell you. But it turned out I didn't.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: My brother said you were about to fire me.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: That's one way to put it.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I bet I know what changed your mind...  ...My mother. She was so horrible, you decided you couldn't desert me.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I thought only action movies had villains like that.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: -- you've been a tremendous help to me.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I can't tell you how much I admire you. You have a wonderful way with people. And you're very insightful. I feel like you've seen me clearly... I never used to admit what a horrible person my mother was. You've made that possible for me.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: That's... good?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Yes! And my ex-husband -- he never accepted me for who I was, just like Mother. The things you've said have helped me understand what a dick he is.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I don't know if --

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: You're shockingly honest, that's what makes you great. I've never had a man treat me this way. With you, I feel really... listened to.  Can I tell you something? It's a little embarrassing, but I feel very unguarded with you.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Thanks to this therapy, I now know what I'm looking for. I need to find a man like you.  Not one who's treating me, of course.  And I'm going to do it, dammit! You've given me the confidence.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I need to talk to you... Doctor. Can I come in?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: It might've been more appropriate if we had followed a traditional approach to the doctor-patient relationship.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Is something wrong, Sofie?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Yes, something's very wrong, Dr. Mumford.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You're upset.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: How intuitive! That must take years of training right there. Maybe you can guess what has upset me.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Is it something you've heard about me?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: No, it is not something I've heard about you! It is someth--  Why? Is there something I should have heard about you?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Why don't you tell me what's on your mind?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: All right... I'm going to come right out and say this, because that's what your shrink is for, right, so you can tell him what's bothering you?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Um-huh.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: First of all, I have been feeling much better lately. I don't know if the syndrome is over -- if it's just run its course or something -- but I feel a hundred per cent better than when I first came to you.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I'm glad.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Given that, I'm obviously not going to be judging things in the most realistic way.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I don't follow you.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I'm saying that since I'm doing so much better -- which I attribute to you -- I'm liable to misinterpret some of my feelings.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Okay...

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: The point is this -- I am not a blank page. I did not just fall off the turnip truck. Do you know what I mean?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I think so.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I know a little about psychology. I took three different courses in college. It's true, none of them were above the two hundred level, but I took them... And there was one concept I remember very well.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Transference!

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Transference.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Yes, and that is what I have got right now. I have taken my feelings of gratitude... and relief... and transferred them onto... you. I have taken all those warm, grateful emotions and confused them with feelings for you... So that now I am under the delusion...  ...that I am in love with you.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I think you can understand why I have some serious questions about your methods. I mean, obviously it becomes much more likely that I'm going to have confusion about this when your idea of treatment is to go walking in the woods and up to make- outs-ville and do all these highly romantic activities --

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Mother...

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: What do you think I'm after, Mrs. Cook?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I guess you saw the show...?

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Which show was that?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Sofie...

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: Part of it. We were watching "ER" until someone called.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You probably got the idea.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: ...How violated I feel?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: You're not the only one...

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: You feel violated?

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: Not me... all my other my patients. I smelled tar and feathers on the way over here.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: You deserve it.

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: I am irate!

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: SOFIE
turns.text: But nothing... I'm mad as hell. This is a terrible thing you've done.

turns.speaker: MUMFORD
turns.text: I know it! Please believe me, I know that...
